workflow.name: AI-powered ticket triage with multi-model classification & knowledge base
workflow.description:
## How It Works
This workflow automates enterprise ticket management by combining AI-powered classification with knowledge base retrieval. It receives support tickets via webhook, routes them through multiple AI models (OpenAI ChatGPT, NVIDIA's text classification APIs, and embeddings-based search) to determine optimal resolution strategies. The system generates contextual diagnostic logs, formats responses, updates ticket systems, notifies engineers when escalation is needed, and seamlessly integrates with knowledge bases for continuous learning. It solves the critical problem of manual ticket sorting and delayed responses by automating intelligent triage, reducing resolution time, and ensuring consistent quality across support operations. Target audience includes support operations teams, technical support managers, and enterprises managing high-volume ticket queues seeking to improve efficiency and SLA compliance.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure the OpenAI API key in credentials.
2. Add NVIDIA API credentials for embedding and classification models.
3. Set up Google Sheets for knowledge base storage and retrieval.
4. Connect your ticketing system (Jira, Zendesk, or webhook) for incoming tickets.
5. Link a notification service (Gmail or Slack) for engineer alerts.
6. Map custom fields to your ticket system schema.

 
## Prerequisites
OpenAI API account with GPT access. NVIDIA API credentials (Embeddings & Classification). Google Sheets for KB management. Ticketing system with webhook capability.  

## Use Cases
SaaS support teams triaging 100+ daily tickets, reducing manual sorting by 80%. Technical support escalating complex issues intelligently while documenting solutions.  

## Customization
Swap OpenAI models for Claude or Anthropic APIs. Replace Google Sheets with database systems (PostgreSQL, Airtable).  

## Benefits
Reduces manual ticket sorting by 70-80%, freeing support staff for complex issues. Decreases average resolution time through intelligent routing.

workflow.name: AI-Powered Ticket Triage with Multi-Model Classification & Knowledge Base

options.systemMessage:
You are an IT helpdesk ticket classifier and resolver.

Your task is to:
1. Analyze the incoming ticket details
2. Classify the ticket type (hardware, software, network, access, other)
3. Search the knowledge base for similar resolved tickets
4. If a matching solution is found, return it with confidence score
5. If no match found, indicate that a new solution needs to be generated

Return your analysis in the structured format defined by the output parser.

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
	"ticketType": "hardware",
	"category": "printer",
	"solutionFound": true,
	"solution": "Restart the printer and check the connection",
	"confidence": 0.95,
	"reasoning": "Based on the symptoms described, this is a common printer connectivity issue"
}

parameters.toolDescription: Search the IT helpdesk knowledge base for similar resolved tickets and solutions

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert IT support engineer specializing in troubleshooting and problem resolution.

Your task is to:
1. Analyze the ticket details carefully
2. Use available MCP tools to gather diagnostic information if needed
3. Generate a detailed step-by-step solution to resolve the issue
4. Provide clear instructions that can be followed by the user or support staff
5. Include any relevant warnings or prerequisites
6. Estimate the complexity level (low, medium, high)

Return your solution in the structured format defined by the output parser.

parameters.query: =UPDATE tickets SET status = '{{ $json.status }}', resolution = '{{ $json.resolution }}', resolved_by = '{{ $json.resolvedBy }}', resolved_at = '{{ $json.resolvedAt }}' WHERE id = {{ $json.ticketId }}

assignments.name: kbEntry

parameters.content:
## How It Works
This workflow automates enterprise ticket management by combining AI-powered classification with knowledge base retrieval. It receives support tickets via webhook, routes them through multiple AI models (OpenAI ChatGPT, NVIDIA's text classification APIs, and embeddings-based search) to determine optimal resolution strategies. The system generates contextual diagnostic logs, formats responses, updates ticket systems, notifies engineers when escalation is needed, and seamlessly integrates with knowledge bases for continuous learning. It solves the critical problem of manual ticket sorting and delayed responses by automating intelligent triage, reducing resolution time, and ensuring consistent quality across support operations. Target audience includes support operations teams, technical support managers, and enterprises managing high-volume ticket queues seeking to improve efficiency and SLA compliance.

## 4. Conditional Routing & Escalation

**What:** Determines whether a ticket requires escalation.
**Why:** Prevents unnecessary engineer notifications and optimizes resource allocation.

## 2. Ticket Classification & Analysis

**What:** Multiple classifiers analyze each ticket.
**Why:** A multi-model approach improves accuracy and captures diverse solution paths.

## 1. Workflow Configuration

**What:** Prepares the data structure for incoming tickets.
**Why:** Ensures consistent formatting for reliable downstream processing.

## Customization
Swap OpenAI models for Claude or Anthropic APIs. Replace Google Sheets with database systems (PostgreSQL, Airtable). 

## Benefits
Reduces manual ticket sorting by 70-80%, freeing support staff for complex issues. Decreases average resolution time through intelligent routing

## Prerequisites
OpenAI API account with GPT access. NVIDIA API credentials (Embeddings & Classification). Google Sheets for KB management. Ticketing system with webhook capability.  

## Use Cases
SaaS support teams triaging 100+ daily tickets, reducing manual sorting by 80%. Technical support escalating complex issues intelligently while documenting solutions.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure the OpenAI API key in credentials.
2. Add NVIDIA API credentials for embedding and classification models.
3. Set up Google Sheets for knowledge base storage 
4. Connect your ticketing system (Jira, Zendesk, or webhook) for incoming tickets.
5. Link a notification service (Gmail or Slack) 
6. Map custom fields to your ticket system schema.

## 3. Solution Generation

**What:** Generates proposed resolutions using AI.
**Why:** Automates response drafting with contextual, high-quality suggestions.

## 5. Knowledge Base Enrichment Update & Notification

**What:** Prepares and adds new entries to the knowledge base and updates
**Why:** Builds institutional knowledge from resolved tickets for future reference.

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
